projects.description: The Random Quote Generator displays a random quote pulled from an array and pairs it with a random background-color. The quote changes on a set interval, or users can click a button to get a new quote/background combo.
projects.focus: JavaScript syntax, variables, loops, conditionals, etc.

projects.description: An interactive form for a fictional conference. Users get immediate feedback when entering invalid feedback. Form fields change based on user selection, and activities with conflicting time slots disable when one is selected.
projects.focus: Form validation, accessibility, conditionals, and RegEx

projects.description: This game randomly selects an idiom from an array and displays blanks on screen to represent letters and words. Users get five lives, losing a life for each incorrect guess. Incorrect guesses change the key to a red color, while correct guesses change the key to a green color. Win or lose, users will land on a page with the option to play again.
projects.focus: Object Oriented JavaScript, callbacks, array iteration

projects.description: Using the public 'Random User Generator API' (https://randomuser.me/documentation), the program fetches a list of 12 random users and displays their data in a grid. Users can click on any employee to view additional detail in a modal. Once the modal is open, users can navigate through the employees.
projects.focus: AJAX basics, HTTP request methods, fetch(), public API requests
